skill.skl_description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a collection of remote computing services (also called web services) that together make up a cloud computing platform, offered over the Internet by Amazon.com. The most central and well-known of these services are Amazon EC2 and Amazon S3.

Android software development is the process by which new applications are created for the Android operating system. Applications are usually developed in the Java programming language using the Android Software Development Kit, but other development tools are available.
AWS Lambda is a compute service where you can upload your code to AWS Lambda and the service can run the code on your behalf using AWS infrastructure.
A blockchain is a distributed database that maintains a continuously-growing list of data records hardened against tampering and revision.

Java is a programming language and a core component of Oracle Corporation's Java Platform. The language derives much of its syntax from C and C++ but has a simpler object model and fewer low-level facilities.

JavaScript is a prototype-based scripting language that is dynamic, weakly typed and has first-class functions. It is a multi-paradigm language, supporting object-oriented, imperative, and functional programming styles.

Node.js is a software system designed for writing highly-scalable internet applications, notably web servers. Programs are written in JavaScript, using event-driven, asynchronous I/O to minimize overhead and maximize scalability.
Parse is an ininfrastructure for mobile apps on multiple platforms.

Vue.js is a library for building interactive web interfaces. The goal of Vue.js is to provide the benefits of reactive data binding and composable view components with an API that is as simple as possible.

WebRTC (Web Real-Time Communication) is an API definition drafted by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) that supports browser-to-browser applications for voice calling, video chat, and P2P file sharing without the need of either internal or external plugins.

dev_profile_title: Node.JS Expert & Full Stack Developer, Startup Guy

dev_blurb:
I am a Software Developer with over 20+ years of experience. Software Development is more than a career for me: it's my passion. I love what I do, and I spare no effort to deliver excellent software products.

My specialty is on Full-stack Web Development (Web applications,. Distributed systems, Scalability, Web Services, APIs, Server Infrastructure).

I put effort towards writing clean, well-written code, because I believe that code quality matters. In order to achieve the highest level of quality, excellence is necessary, even in the things you can't see. So I am very detailed-oriented in every aspect of my work.

Over the years, I've realized that if you follow a short set of rules (and stick to them!!) your projects will always succeed. These are my 6 rules for successful projects.

 1. Never stop learning (always keep up to date)
 2. Hard work and consistency (never procrastinate, because later = never)
 3. Organization and cleanliness (organize all tasks and keep them up-to-date)
 4. Quality in everything, even in the things clients don't see
 5. Clear and constant communication
 6. Discuss everything up front (schedules, requirements, problems, solutions, etc)

I hope these will help you on your future projects. Send me a message in you're interested in discussing how to take your projects and ideas to the next level.

ABOUT MY EXPERIENCE

If you're interested in learning more about my experience as a Software Developer, the following few paragraphs describe my history as a developer in some detail.

For my first 10 years developing software (1995 – 2005), I focused on game development using C/C++, Python, LUA, Assembly Language, OpenGL, DirectX, etc. This was very low-level programming, which is completely different from Web Development, because it deals very closely with memory, the CPU and GPU, and other low-level computer concepts. I specifically focused in 3D Computer Graphics and Game Logic. To this day, I consider that this experience shaped me to become the professional that I am today.

Over the next 12 years (2005 - Present) I've focused on mobile & web development, using a myriad of languages (PHP, Python, Ruby, Javascript, Java, Groovy, Objective-C, Swift, CSS, HTML) and a myriad of frameworks (Django, Laravel, Code Igniter, Flask, Ruby on Rails, Groovy on Grails) and many other front-end frameworks (jQuery UI, AngularJS, ReactJS, ExtJS).

I'm also the founder and chief software architect of LionMane Software, a small development studio where I spearhead a specialized team of developers focused on full-stack web development. We specialize in creating software products for web and mobile platforms.

As of today, I use the following languages & technologies, which I'm strongly experienced with:

• PHP and Python for backend development
• Javascript, jQuery, AngularJS, AJAX, JSON, Bootstrap, HTML, CSS (LESS and SASS)
• RESTful APIs (Producing and Consuming)
• GIT (Github and Bitbucket)
• Database and Server programming
• Laravel, CodeIgniter, Django, Flask
• iOS app development with Swift and Objective-C

I hope this was informative for you, and if you'd like a full version of my Resumé, please don't hesitate to write. I look forward to working with you to take your projects to the next level.

Sincerely,
Mario J. Wunderlich

skill.skl_description: AngularJS is an open-source web application framework, maintained by Google and community, that assists with creating single-page applications, one-page web applications that only require HTML, CSS, and JavaScript on the client side.

Java is a programming language and a core component of Oracle Corporation's Java Platform. The language derives much of its syntax from C and C++ but has a simpler object model and fewer low-level facilities.

JavaScript is a prototype-based scripting language that is dynamic, weakly typed and has first-class functions. It is a multi-paradigm language, supporting object-oriented, imperative, and functional programming styles.

Mobile application development is the process by which application software is developed for low-power handheld devices, such as personal digital assistants, enterprise digital assistants or mobile phones.
Objective-C is a reflective, object-oriented programming language that adds Smalltalk-style messaging to the C programming language.
PHP is a general-purpose server-side scripting language originally designed for web development to produce dynamic web pages.

Python is a general-purpose, high-level programming language whose design philosophy emphasizes code readability. Python claims to combine "remarkable power with very clear syntax", and its standard library is large and comprehensive.
Swift is a multi-paradigm, compiled programming language developed by Apple for iOS and OS X development.
Web development is a broad term for the work involved in developing a web site for the Internet (World Wide Web) or an intranet (a private network).

experience.exp_comment: I am the founder, CEO, and Chief Software Architect of LionMane Software.

Part of a small elite 3-person engineering team that oversees all software development & technical specs for a national-wide business.

From custom e-commerce solutions, to back-end tools, to custom emailing analytics platforms -- I've contributed software & analysis for all aspects of Bisnow's business model.

I was part of a startup based in Palo Alto, California. I lead the effort to create a GIF generation iOS app called "Clippo" which allowed users to capture videos, caption them with text, then finally converted them to GIFs for easy sharing across the web & social networks.

Created a game called Billion for iOS, using Objective-C. Started as a part-time project, but decided to make it a full-time project in order to finish, polish, and distribute it Apple App Store. Game was launched under the RAWR! Interactive label, which I owned.

I worked as part of a special development group in Xerox, creating financial software solutions for large clients. As a senior engineer of this group, I analyzed, drafted requirements, assigned tasks, and developed solutions in order to obtain specific client-oriented goals.

As part of a small 6-man team, we developed 3D video games for a large media company. I was in charge of creating SDKs and APIs for various systems, such as UI, HUD, as well as the foundation code used as backbone of our entire fully-custom game engine.

dev_blurb:

My current area of interest is complete management of a mobile app development project from designing to publishing on app store.

MOBILE BACKGROUND
Good knowledge of Mobile UI patterns, guidelines., low-level performance optimizations and memory management. I not only know how to make an application work, but also know how to make it work fast and smoothly. Following are my achievements & skills

skill.skl_description: Android software development is the process by which new applications are created for the Android operating system. Applications are usually developed in the Java programming language using the Android Software Development Kit, but other development tools are available.
Xcode is a suite of tools developed by Apple for developing software for Mac OS X and iOS, first released in 2003.

Cocoa is Apple's native object-oriented application programming interface (API) for the Mac OS X operating system and along with the Cocoa Touch extension for gesture recognition and animation for applications for the iOS operating system, used on Apple devices such as the iPhone, the iPod Touch,
Game development is the generally involved and lengthy process of creating a video game. Development is undertaken by a game developer, which may range from a single person to a large business.

The iPad is a line of tablet computers designed, developed and marketed by Apple Inc., primarily as a platform for audio-visual media including books, periodicals, movies, music, games, and web content.

An iPhone App is an application software developed with the iOS SDK for use with Apple, Inc.'s iPhone line of smartphones. Apps have diverse functions, including games, reference, GPS navigation, social networking, security, and advertising for television shows, films, and celebrities.

Java is a programming language and a core component of Oracle Corporation's Java Platform. The language derives much of its syntax from C and C++ but has a simpler object model and fewer low-level facilities.

Mobile application development is the process by which application software is developed for low-power handheld devices, such as personal digital assistants, enterprise digital assistants or mobile phones.
Objective-C is a reflective, object-oriented programming language that adds Smalltalk-style messaging to the C programming language.
Unity is an integrated authoring tool for creating 3D video games or other interactive content such as architectural visualizations or real-time 3D animations.
